Sources: New Orleans nurses offered immunity in deaths





Two nurses accused in the post-Katrina deaths of four patients at New Orleans'
Memorial Medical Center have been offered immunity to testify before a special
grand jury, sources close to the investigation tell CNN.





FULL STORY
















Nine 'courageous firefighters' die in warehouse blaze





An inferno raced through a Charleston, South Carolina, furniture warehouse,
collapsing its roof and killing nine firefighters in a tragedy that the city's
mayor described Tuesday as  "difficult to fathom."

Baby found miles from where pregnant woman vanished





A newborn girl was found in a basket on a doorstep 45 miles from where a
pregnant woman vanished, authorities said Tuesday.

Toddler's body found in tree after flooding





The body of a 2-year-old girl was found in a tree Tuesday, nearly 3 miles
downstream from where her family's mobile home was swept away a day earlier by
flooding blamed for six deaths.





FULL STORY

Disbarred Duke D.A. stripped of badge





A judge suspended District Attorney Mike Nifong on Tuesday -- effective
immediately -- after learning the prosecutor disbarred for his handling of the
Duke lacrosse rape case intended to stay in office for another month.





FULL STORY

Cruise interrupted by search for missing passenger





A cruise ship that had turned around to look for a missing passenger resumed
its voyage Tuesday as the Coast Guard began a second day of searching for the
24-year-old man.

Death toll in Baghdad truck bombing rises to 87





A massive truck bomb that exploded in a crowded Baghdad square killed at least
87 people and wounded 214, Iraq's Interior Ministry said Wednesday.

U.N.: Refugee numbers to rise





The numbers of people driven from their homes by violence, natural disasters
and poverty across the world is almost certain to rise in the future, the U.N.
refugee chief said Tuesday.

Fleeing Hamas, Gazans trapped at Israeli crossing





Hundreds of terrified Gazans fleeing Hamas rule were trapped at a squalid
crossing with Israel on Tuesday, hoping for permission to pass through Israeli
territory to sanctuary in the West Bank.

Suu Kyi turns 62 in confinement





Myanmar opposition leader and democracy campaigner Aung San Suu Kyi spent
another birthday under house arrest on Tuesday, as her supporters released
doves and balloons to accompany prayers for her release.

Students make extra bucks as medical guinea pigs 





College students are known for finding creative ways to earn money, but few
can compete with Boston University senior Allison Yochim -- who once earned
cash watching dueling images of sea turtles and hardcore pornography.

Report: Parents would back limits on media violence, sex 





Two-thirds of parents said they are very concerned about sex and violence the
nation's children are exposed to in the media, and there would be broad
support for new federal limits on such material on television, said a survey
released Tuesday.

Video game gets banned





British censors Tuesday banned a video game for the first time in 10 years,

focus on sadism and brutal slaying.
